title: (x) dotted font in Hotdog Movie Quiz logo - (similar to) Unda {Lex}
content:
Hello folks,  
I have looked everywhere and can't find a dot font like this that has 3 rows of dots. Is this a custom-made job perhaps?  
Regards  
PAUL ROSS  
SkyRocket Design Co  
 [Web Design Sydney](http://web.archive.org/web/20140529083857/http:/www.skyrocket.com.au/)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [hotdog.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140529083857/http:/typophile.com/files/hotdog.jpg) | 63.65 KB |
author: skyrocket

comments.content:
Other than the G, [Unda](http://web.archive.org/web/20140529083857/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/unda/square-regular/testdrive.html?s=HOT+DOG&p=72) from T-26 seems to fit. If you're just looking 3 dot wide strokes, it should work for you.

- Lex

Thank you Lex. Unda Circles seems to be almost an exact match. Just tested it on the T-26 font setter widget and it is very close. My sample has an extra row of dots though which could have been added manually I guess to extend the font sidways slightly. You can see there are 4 dots across to make the tops of the bowls whereas Unda Circles has three. Great pick though.

Not exactly the font but maybe the freeware **Lights One, Two, Three** from Torbjörn Olsson would work as well.

On this page: [http://a4.net/svensk/typsnitt/index.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20140529083857/http:/a4.net/svensk/typsnitt/index.htm "http://a4.net/svensk/typsnitt/index.htm")
